theorem putnam_2021_a6 :
  (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) →
    (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) →

  have step : (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) → (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) → (P.eval 2 ≠ 0 ∧ P.eval 2 ≠ 1 ∧ ¬Prime (P.eval 2))) ↔ putnam_2021_a6_solution := by

-/

  (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) →
    (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) →

```lean4
theorem putnam_2021_a6 :
  (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) →
    (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) →
    (P.eval 2 ≠ 0 ∧ P.eval 2 ≠ 1 ∧ ¬Prime (P.eval 2)))
  ↔ putnam_2021_a6_solution := by
  have step₁ : (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) → (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) → (P.eval 2 ≠ 0 ∧ P.eval 2 ≠ 1 ∧ ¬Prime (P.eval 2))) ↔ putnam_2021_a6_solution := by
    apply Iff.intro
    · intro h
      exact by
        have h₁ := h (Polynomial.C 1)
        have h₂ := h (Polynomial.C 0)
        have h₃ := h (Polynomial.C 2)
        have h₄ := h (Polynomial.C 3)
        have h₅ := h (Polynomial.X)
        have h₆ := h (Polynomial.X ^ 2)
        have h₇ := h (Polynomial.C 1 * Polynomial.X)
        have h₈ := h (Polynomial.C 1 * Polynomial.X ^ 2)
        have h₉ := h (Polynomial.C 2 * Polynomial.X)
        have h₁₀ := h (Polynomial.C 2 * Polynomial.X ^ 2)
        norm_num [Polynomial.eval_C, Polynomial.eval_X, Polynomial.eval_mul, Polynomial.eval_pow] at h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆ h₇ h₈ h₉ h₁₀ <;>
        (try contradiction) <;>
        (try simp_all [Polynomial.coeff_C, Polynomial.coeff_X, Polynomial.coeff_X_pow, Polynomial.coeff_C]) <;>
        (try ring_nf at * <;> norm_num [prime_def'] at *) <;>
        (try aesop)
        <;> aesop
    · intro h
      exact by
        intro P hP hP'
        have h₁ := hP'
        obtain ⟨Q, R, hQdeg, hRdeg, hPQ⟩ := hP'
        have h₂ := hP 0
        have h₃ := hP 1
        have h₄ := hP (natDegree P)
        have h₅ := hP (natDegree P + 1)
        have h₆ := hP (natDegree P + 2)
        have h₇ := hP (natDegree P + 3)
        have h₈ := hP (natDegree P + 4)
        have h₉ := hP (natDegree P + 5)
        have h₁₀ := hP (natDegree P + 6)
        have h₁₁ := hP (natDegree P + 7)
        have h₁₂ := hP (natDegree P + 8)
        have h₁₃ := hP (natDegree P + 9)
        simp at h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆ h₇ h₈ h₉ h₁₀ h₁₁ h₁₂ h₁₃
        norm_num at *
        aesop
  exact step₁
```

-/
theorem putnam_2021_a6 :
  (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) →
    (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) →
    (P.eval 2 ≠ 0 ∧ P.eval 2 ≠ 1 ∧ ¬Prime (P.eval 2)))

theorem putnam_2021_a6 :
  (∀ P, (∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n = 0 ∨ P.coeff n = 1) →
    (∃ Q R : Polynomial ℤ, Q.degree > 0 ∧ R.degree > 0 ∧ P = Q * R) →
    (P.eval 2 ≠ 0 ∧ P.eval 2 ≠ 1 ∧ ¬Prime (P.eval 2)))
  ↔ putnam_2021_a6_solution := by
  unfold putnam_2021_a6_solution
  -- We construct a polynomial P with coefficients in {0,1} that cannot be factored into two nonconstant polynomials with integer coefficients.

  <;> simp [Nat.prime_iff]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> aesop
